pullRequest.body:
Basic setup for `fun_prop` for Differentiable(At/On/Within) and HasFDeriv(At/Within/Strict).

Mainly consists of marking theorems with `fun_prop` attribute but I had to formulate appropriate `_pi` and `_apply` theorems. Proofs of `_apply` theorems can probably be golfed into neater form.



---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Can you add some tests for `HasFDeriv`? E.g. can you automatically prove `HasDeriv (fun x => x^2) 0 0`? (note: I don't want the derivative to be `2*0` or `2*0^1`)

(not sure if you do `HasDeriv` in this PR as well)

The fact that `fun_prop` can solve `HasFDerivAt` is just a happy coincidence. The tactic is not really designed to compute derivatives.

For example
```
#check (by fun_prop : HasFDerivAt (ùïú:=‚Ñù) (fun x : ‚Ñù => x*x) _ (0 : ‚Ñù))
```
prints out 
```
HasFDerivAt.mul (hasFDerivAt_id' 0)
  (hasFDerivAt_id' 0) : HasFDerivAt (fun y => y * y) (0 ‚Ä¢ ContinuousLinearMap.id ‚Ñù ‚Ñù + 0 ‚Ä¢ ContinuousLinearMap.id ‚Ñù ‚Ñù) 0
```
You can see that no simplification took place.

I'm working on `fun_trans` tactic which is designed to compute nice derivatives. It is just a custom simproc so all those zero eliminations are handled by the simplifier.

I don't think that modifying `fun_prop` to compute nice derivatives is a good idea. The tactic is complicated enough already. Therefore, either we leave it like this or remove `@[fun_prop]` from all the `HasFDerivAt` theorems.
And yes `HasDeriv` is not part of this PR. Only files in `Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.FDeriv.*` were touched. I will make a PR with `Mathlib.Analysis.Calculus.Deriv.*` files some other day.
PS: You are probably aware that there are more files that should be tagged, e.g. `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions.Pow.Deriv`, and probably a whole lot more in `Mathlib.Analysis.SpecialFunctions`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8187169749/job/22387079400)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8187169749/job/22387078924)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8187169749/job/22387079157)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: set up fun_prop for Differentiable and HasFDeriv
